Quick note .. first, sorry about the "minimal functionality" of "Gladpack"
and "extract" ... they were quick tools that we hacked up when we realized
we needed them, and they never advanced from their base versions.
 
However, I just wanted to make sure you knew that unpack can take wildcards,
in case you were extracting them truly one at a time .. basically an "unpack
*.pix" style command would extract all the .pix files, etc.
 
--Tom

-----Original Message-----
From: Zardus@... [mailto:Zardus@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 02, 2002 7:32 PM
To: gladiator@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [gladiator] Digest Number 469


On Tue, 2 Jul 2002, Tom Tildrum wrote:

> "Gladpack" can make .001 files, and "Unpack" can
> extract stuff from .001 files... I've been meaning to
> make master versions of the Levels.001 and
> Graphics.001 once we've worked out what are "accepted"
> fan-made scenarios and what the titles will be.
> Unfortunately, you can't add to a .001 file, so first
> you need to unpack all the old stuff and make entirely
> new Graphics.001 and Levels.001 files, and there are a
> LOT of graphics files that can only be extracted one
> at a time.

OpenGlad-0.1 contains all the pix files in unpacked form (I think that's
all of them at least). Same with the scenarios. Its at
http://sourceforge.net/projects/snowstorm
<http://sourceforge.net/projects/snowstorm> 

Hope that helps.

- Yan
